Title: Friends
Description: A quick summary of trial-and-error behavior of agents and how imitation effectivness changes over social networks and exploration parameters

Title: MPAs
Description: “Fishing the line” emerges as a behavior out of trial-and-error agents when an MPA is implemented together with diffusing biology

Title: Bycatch
Description: 2 species sea: one of them is profitable, the other is endangered and carries a fine. Through trial and error agents learn quickly to avoid areas where the endangered specie is

Title: Gas and gear
Description: High gas prices drive the acquisition of fuel efficient gear

Title: Effort
Description: Effort, as in probability of going out, as a function of market prices and viceversa

Title: Lambda
Description: A test of how fishers would value an additional ITQ quota with some examples of price reservation dispersion

Title: ITQ Market
Description: Preliminary results on the distributive effects of the ITQ market

Title: Where to fish
Description: A slow-mo version of how fishers choose where to go tow and a small comparison with how it is done in other models. Plus a cautionary tale about looking for one great heuristic

Title: Weather
Description: Mini-demo of agents reacting to high winds

Title: Gas and location
Description: Gas price affect where you go fishing

Title: ITQ opportunity costs
Description: Opportunity costs can drive fishers behavior geographically when one specie is protected by ITQ and the other one isn't

Title: Habitat
Description: Forcing gear that doesn't work in rocky areas creates fishing the line

Title: Two species ITQ
Description: Two species ITQ where one specie have a much curtailed quota will generate the right kind of quota prices

Title: Two species ITQ and gear
Description: Two species ITQ and their incentive to change gear and fishing location

Title: Two species ITQ and location
Description: Comparison between ITQ and TACs and their effect on fisher locations

Title: Osmose
Description: OSMOSE simulation and integration with our model

Title: Bayes Optimization
Description: An example of how to use Bayesian Optimization to find parameters in the model that optimize a score function

Title: QBME
Description: How to use optimizer to find interesting runs and how social networks can be made to evolve over time

Title: Optimal MPA
Description: How the optimizer maximizes the policy score when all it can do is set an MPA

Title: Race to fish
Description: An example of race to fish in our model and how ITQs solves it

Title: Heterogeneous fleets
Description: Two different fleet subject to different rules

Title: California
Description: How the model reads in California's map

Title: Population pyramid
Description: A demographic pyramid of a simulated Dover Sole over the year

Title: Optimal Selectivity
Description: Optimizing catches by selecting the gear with the right selectivity

Title: Change in utility
Description: Changing utility functions to induce a change

Title: Data fit proposal
Description: A discussion on how to fit the model to real data

Title: Hyperstability
Description: An example of how the model exhibits hyperstability but it is possible to use an optimizer to find parameters for which the opposite is true

Title: Manchester presentation
Description: Slidedeck for Manchester presentation

Title: Kernel heatmaps
Description: An example of kernel heatmaps to be used in the future

Title: NN Heatmaps
Description: An example of nearest neighbor regressions applied to location choices

Title: Planning vs Searching
Description: I introduce here the new framework over which agents make decisions the details are still to fill in but this is what we'll be working with next

Title: A look at WFS Osmose
Description: A look at how OSMOSE  and our model interact and what is needed to get some sort of realistic behaviour

Title: Adaptive Tax
Description: A policy-maker agent that sets taxes based on how much biomass is left

Title: INET Presentation
Description: Slidedeck for my presentation at INET regarding various alternative algorithms agents can use to make decisions

Title: MPA Shapes
Description: Experiment with running optimization over MPA shapes of any size

Title: Endogenous Discovery of Policies
Description: Using reinforcement learning to generate a feedback controller from scratch to regulate the fishery

Title: A worked example of fitting Poseidon
Description: How to find the behavioural parameters that best fit the data

Title: Avoiding the line
Description: An example of imposing both an MPA and an ITQ and see people avoiding the line

Title: An example of indirect inference
Description: A worked example of how indirect inference would be used to fit behavioural rules and rank which algorithm is more realistic

Title: Four ways of satisficing
Description: Looking at four different ways of modelling satisficing behaviour in fishers and how their relative `greed` can have strong effects on aggregate biomass

Title: Random Utility Model
Description: Coded in the classic random utility model agent; what we called sometimes statistical agents; i want to use them to generate synthetic logbooks

Title: Enforcement
Description: Enforcement can now be imperfect and we can observe how agents react if they only care about money
